Blog Post #1

*Below is an example of using R and Python together.*
```{r}
library(reticulate)
```


```{python}
import re
string1=""

re.findall(r'A[ATCG]TAAT', string1)
re.findall(r'GC[AG][AT]TG', string1)
```
*This code matches restriction enzyme binding sites ANTAAT and GCRWTG. Note that per the IUPAC nucleotide code, N is any base, R is A or G, W is A or T.*

```{r}
#split nucleotide sequence into individual vectors
nuc_vector<-strsplit(py$string1, "")[[1]]
#count frequency of each base
table(nuc_vector)
```
*This code results in the the total frequencies of each base in string 1.*
